did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Papers, 1937-2015 (bulk 1970-1990). This collection contains papers related to the organization Up with People. The bulk of the material consists of photographic and audiovisual materials from Up with People performances and events as well as musical arrangements, programs and publications. Also included are some organizational records and memorabilia. A small amount of material is related to Moral Re-armament.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Up with People Archives (MS491). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Up with People is an international educational nonprofit organization aimed at creating young adults with global understanding through musical performance, international tours and community service. Up with People emerged in 1965 from Sing Outs. Moral Re-armament, an international morality and spirituality movement, sponsored these shows which attracted young people with its positive message of love, honesty, purity and unselfishness. J. Blanton Belk, the founder of Up with People, incorporated in 1968 with the encouragement of President Dwight Eisenhower and German Chancellor Konrad Adenauer and then separated from Moral Re-armament. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado since 1993, Up with People began in Tucson, Arizona with the University of Arizona serving as the staging center for several months each year as new cast members- young men and women between 18 and 29 learned songs and choreography. Up with People has performed at a variety of notable events including the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich, four NFL Super Bowl half time shows and several World Expos as well as for dignitaries around the world. Up with People suspended its programs in 2000 but returned after reorganization in 2004. Today Up with People continues to use music as a way to create understanding between cultures and impact communities worldwide through service in order to create global citizens. It is an independent nonprofit, 501(c)(3) organization without any religious or political affiliations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 10 series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of the organization Up with People. The bulk of the material includes photographic and audiovisual material from Up with People performances and events. It also contains musical arrangements including scores, sheet music, song translations and symphony arrangements, publications such as newsletters, programs and promotional material and organizational records including annual reports, yearbooks, correspondence and manuals.
The series contains reports, yearbooks, correspondence, and handbooks associated with Up with People. The series is divided into three subseries.

This subseries contains correspondence regarding Up with People events, tours, alumni and fans as well as manuals, staff informational packets, schedules and other employee handouts regarding different programs and the administration of the organization. Also included are materials related to Moral Re-armament. It is arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: This subseries contains yearbooks produced by Up with People as well as other writings related to the experiences of different cast members. It is arranged chronologically.
This series contains publications distributed by Up with People including newsletters, programs, songbooks and magazines. It is divided into four subseries.
This series contains news publications produced by and for Up with People and alumni. It is arranged alphabetically.
This series contains programs from Up with People performances.
This series contains books of songs related to Up with People.

The Up with People Song Book Vol. 11-13,
The Up with People Song Book Vol. 14-15,

scopecontent.p: This series contains a run of Dare/Pace magazine. Pace Magazine (previously known as Dare Magazine) was a monthly magazine produced by Pace Publications. Pace Publications was a division of Moral Re-armament and also produced some Up with People record albums. It is arranged chronologically.

The series contains scores used by Up with People. Scores contain the music for the entire orchestra. It is arranged alphabetically according to score title with several scores contained in each folder.

The series contains symphony arrangements produced by Up with People. Symphony arrangements are the scores for a full symphony of instruments. The series is arranged alphabetically according to symphony title.

scopecontent.p: This series is composed of photographs, negatives, and slides and photographic albums documenting various events, performances, and notable figures involved with Up with People. The series is divided into five subseries.
The 35mm negatives in this subseries have no title or date affixed to the negative envelope. The envelopes are numbered and are arranged alphabetically and by original numerical order.

scopecontent.p: This series is composed of audio visual materials. It contains performances, interviews and special appearances by Up with People. It is divided into three subseries.

This subseries contains professional recordings of Up with People music and performances as well as records of various people associated with Up with People such as the Colwell Brothers and Frank Fields. This subseries is arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.p: This series is composed of costumes, buttons, and other artifacts that are significant to the Up with People organization.
